content:
Diagnosis:	Malignant melanoma, right calf primary, AJCC Stage IIIB (pT3bN2aM0)
	Initial excision biopsy 12 March 2024 showing 2.8mm Breslow thickness with ulceration
	Wide local excision and right groin node dissection 28 March 2024
	NRAS G12D mutation positive, BRAF wild type

I reviewed [redacted name] today for week 12 assessment in the NEMO-02 trial of combination MEK/CDK4/6 inhibition in NRAS-mutant melanoma. She has completed the initial 12-week treatment phase with binimetinib and palbociclib, showing excellent compliance with the study protocol despite some initial challenges with side effects.

The week 8 restaging CT showed partial response by RECIST 1.1 criteria with 45% reduction in the sum of target lesions compared to baseline. Her right inguinal lymphadenopathy has reduced from 32mm to 18mm, and the external iliac nodes have decreased from 28mm to 15mm. No new lesions were identified.

She has experienced grade 2 fatigue and grade 1 peripheral edema, both of which have been manageable with supportive measures. The initial grade 2 CPK elevation noted at week 4 has resolved following the protocol-mandated dose reduction of binimetinib to 30mg BD. Her latest blood tests show stable parameters with CPK now within normal range at 140 U/L.

On examination today, her performance status remains 0. The surgical sites are well-healed with no evidence of local recurrence. There is ongoing reduction in the palpable right inguinal lymphadenopathy. Her blood pressure is well-controlled at 128/76 mmHg with no evidence of retinopathy on the protocol-mandated ophthalmology review last week.

Given the excellent partial response and current tolerability, we will continue with the current doses of both study medications. I have arranged the protocol-specified week 16 CT scan and have scheduled the next trial visit in 4 weeks' time. She has been counselled regarding the ongoing need to avoid sun exposure and to report any new skin lesions promptly. The trial coordinator has arranged the required quality of life assessments and pharmacokinetic sampling for the next visit.

primary_cancer.metastases: right inguinal and external iliac lymph nodes
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: NRAS G12D mutation positive, BRAF wild type

cancer_timeline.value: Initial excision biopsy showing 2.8mm Breslow thickness with ulceration
Wide local excision and right groin node dissection
Started NEMO-02 trial of binimetinib and palbociclib
Binimetinib dose reduced to 30mg BD due to grade 2 CPK elevation
CT shows 45% reduction in target lesions - right inguinal nodes reduced from 32mm to 18mm, external iliac nodes decreased from 28mm to 15mm

patient_facts.value: Surgical sites well-healed with no evidence of local recurrence
CPK now within normal range at 140 U/L

status_updates.value: Stage IIIB melanoma showing excellent partial response to NEMO-02 trial treatment with manageable toxicities
Partial response with 45% reduction in target lesions on week 8 CT scan
Grade 2 fatigue and grade 1 peripheral edema, previous grade 2 CPK elevation resolved
Continuing current doses of binimetinib and palbociclib
Next trial visit in 4 weeks with quality of life assessments and pharmacokinetic sampling
